page.title: 07Buxhall - Housing
page.content:
There are{140 dwellings}in the area (including 3 derelict). 50% are in the main village of Buxhall which is grouped around the Crown Public House, Mill and former school. Much of the housing in the village is{local {authority}built in the 1930s and 50s. In the area as a whole 55 houses pre- date 1800: 16 built 1800-1914: 19 from 1914-1945: 37 1945-1960: 9 1960-1975 and 4 1975-1985. There have been few {new houses}in the area, a reflection of its rural character and in part the restrictive planning policy applying.
About 30% of families in the area are "local" having lived there more than one generation.Most have links with agriculture, as farmworkers or farmers. Over the years families with less strong links with the land tend to move away to find houses or work.
